Name: All persons involved in this task analysis to sign here
Base flashing installed & taped with correct fall
Flashing junctions cut correctly & uniformed - as rev details
Site clean, rubbish in bin or removed
Framing supports at 400mm centres (in one direction). All plywood edges must also be supported.
Do not use tongue and groove plywood. Viking Roofspec can accept the maximum support spacings provided in Table 15C of CHH Ecoply Specification Guide.
Minimum thickness 17mm, F8, CCA H3.2 treated, structural plywood (not LOSP treated).
Minimum CD grade with the sanded C face upwards.
Plywood laid with face grain at right angles to supports.
Plywood is to be laid with staggered joints in a brick bond pattern with a 3mm expansion gap between plywood sheet edges.
Plywood is screw-fixed with 10g x 50mm SS counter-sunk screws at 150mm centres on all sheet edges and at 200mm centres through the body of the sheet. All screws to be counter sunk 1-2mm.
Chamfer all external edges with a minimum radius of 5mm.

*Plywood is to be kept dry at all times during construction. Blow/ torch drying the plywood surface prior to membrane application does not comply. Plywood and framing supports to be at no more than 18%moisture content.

For Roofs and Roof Decks over living spaces, all cavities must be ventilated and insulated in compliance with clause H1 NZBC. Cavity ventilation is not required for a Warm Roof system which meets or exceeds the minimum R value requirements.
All drains and outlets are membrane compatible.
Note that TPO membranes cannot be welded to Stainless Steel scuppers or sumps. Accessories must have Clamped Grates or be TPO weldable.
Ensure minimum required falls are met. E2/AS1 2011 states 2° for roofs (-1:30 or 34mm/mt), 1.5° for decks (-1:40 or 25mm/mt) and 1:100 (10mm/mt) for internal gutters.
Spouting installed with correct falls & outlets as per plans
Site clean, rubbish in bin or removed
Brackets set up in correct centres
Droppers installed and in correct location
Water test completed and no ponding
Windows Installed and Set 18 - 20mm out from Batten
Head flashing Installed Taped and Stop ended
Window / Door/ Base Flashing Screwed at 300mm Centres
Plastic Soakers Installed Around Window / Door Jams
Purlins as specified, Correct fixings and spacings. Installed straight.
Plywood correct thickness, installed correctly with specified fixings.
Liner deck correctly installed and correct lengths
Liner deck fixings as per roof logic specifications
Post and rails correct spacings as per Roof logic
Fixings as per roof logic specifications
Installed and to the specified R value
Top sheet installed in the correct sequence
Sheets correct lengths and turn ups / downs done
QA - Rooflogic Fibertherm MSR Roofing System Checklist
Prompting Name: Rooflogic Fibertherm MSR Roofing System Checklist

Name: RL Liner Deck is installed in accordance with specification
RL Liner Deck is installed in accordance with project specific and Rooflogic standard details
Correct fasteners used and installed with correct frequency (i.e. 1 fastener per trough along every purlin line)
Seal all side laps to RL Liner Deck with RL Butyl Lap Tape
Seal all end laps with RL Mastic
Close off RL Liner deck with combination of metal under/over flashing and RL Foam closure as per details
Structural Rail assembly installed per standard details, project specific plans and details ensuring that vertical face of rail faces towards the ridge.
Structural Rail installed in line with every structural purlin line with structural posts installed at nominal centres based on Fibertherm span table.
Posts installed with 2 screws per base.
Insulation installed over dry liner deck

RL Elite Insulation to run vertically down the roof rolling over the structural rail and post (tightly butted and end and side junctions). Insulation to be cut along structural rail lines and pushed tightly under the rail.
RL Topdeck to be installed over RL Elite Insulation. Install no more RL Elite insulation that can be covered with the metal top skin in the same working day.

Visually inspect material delivered to site. Confirm all delivered materials correspond with order
and specification.
Fix according to specified fixing pattern to achieve required wind uplift resistance (refer to Topdeck TDS)
Allowance for thermal expansion when fixing sheets (refer to Topdeck TDS)
Sheet length as required to achieve specified gutter overhang
Installation of fixings in accordance with specification and appropriate wind zone
All flashing details in accordance with specifications, plans and details with correct type and spacing of fixings and placement of seals and sealants
All construction equipment and materials removed from roof/site
Any damage to top skin or associated flashings rectified by repair or replacement
Debris, sward and other contamination cleared/removed from roof
Maintenance Documents submitted to Main Contractor/Building Owner
